snippet.title: James Bond 007 Game (Parker Brothers) ColecoVision Longplay
snippet.description:
James Bond 007 is a side-scrolling video game that sees the player controlling a car which can travel on land, underwater and also 'jump' through the air. The car can fire a missile upwards diagonally and release a flare bomb into the air which falls in a downward arc. the game takes place across 4 levels, each loosely based on a particular Bond movie and with a particular objective to complete before proceeding to the next level. To reach each objective, the player needs to avoid crashing in to obstacles or enemies and avoid being hit by enemy fire. 

Each level based on a James Bond movie as follows: 

Level 1: Diamonds Are Forever - Across desert and sea at night, avoid the laser beam from the satellite and the craters it creates; armed frogmen, submarines and mines to land on the oil rig. Shoot the orbiting diamonds to light the way and reveal the oil rig against the night sky. 

Level 2: The Spy Who Loved Me - A sea-based mission. Avoid missiles launched from the sea bed, helicopters, mines and ships. Bomb Stromberg's undersea laboratory and rescue the escape pod that carries agent Anya Amasova. 

Level 3: Moonraker - Avoid Moonraker space shuttle launches, armed frogmen, submarines and mines. To complete the mission, destroy 3 poison globes launched from space. 

Level 4: For Your Eyes Only - Across darkened waters off the Greek mainland, launch flare bombs to light up the sea and make your enemies visible. Avoid frogmen, submarines, mines and jellyfish in the dark depths of the sea and armed helicopters from above. Complete your mission by diving down to the sunken fishing trawler to retrieve the top secret missile launching radio equipment. 

At the end of the game, you are awarded an agent rating. The highest rating on the 'Beginner' setting is 005, the highest on the 'Advanced' setting is 007, naturally. 

This long-play was played on a ColecoVision on the beginner difficulty setting. 

Released: 1983
Platforms: ColecoVision, Commodore 64, Atari 2600, Atari 5200, atari 8-bit family and Sega SG-1000 (Japan)
Developer: Parker Brothers
Publisher: Parker Brothers
